alert.note: Alert for Fresno (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 04 at 12:45AM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM PST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central California, including the following county, Fresno. * WHEN...Until 645 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1245 AM PST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. This will cause small stream flooding. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Balch Power House and Hume Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
